name: api_api_buy_vps
desc: Places a VPS order in our system. These are the same parameters as api_validate_buy_vps..   Returns a comma seperated list of invoices if any need paid.

sid.name: sid
sid.description: the *Session ID* you get from the [login](#login) call

slices.name: slices
slices.description: 1 to 16 specifying the scale of the VPS resources you want (a 3 slice has 3x the resources of a 1 slice vps)

controlpanel.name: controlpanel
controlpanel.description: none, cpanel, or da for None, cPanel, or DirectAdmin control panel addons, only available with CentOS

period.name: period
period.description: 1-36, How frequently to be billed in months. Some discounts as given based on the period

rootpass.name: rootpass
rootpass.description: Desired Root Password (unused for windows, send a blank string)

description.invoices_id: ID of the Invoice used for referencing
description.invoices_description: Description of what the Invoice was for
description.invoices_custid: ID of the Customer this Invoice is for
description.invoices_type: The Type of Invoice (1 = charge, 10+ are payment types)
description.invoices_group: Billing Group the Invoice falls under, Not currently used
description.invoices_extra: If type 1 invoice this points to the repeat invoice id, otherwise points to the id of the charge invoice its a payment for.
description.invoices_paid: Whether or not the Invoice was paid (if applicable)
description.invoices_module: Module the Invoice was for.  You can use [get_modules](#get-modules) to get a list of available modules.
description.invoices_service: ID of the Service/Order this Invoice is for such as 1000 if the order was vps1000 and the module was vps

example.status_text: Password must contain atleast 8 characters, one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one number, a special character and autogenerated password filled in it.
